acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Charlotte County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: In 1909 S. C. Daniel was appointed trustee to oversee the assets of the Charlotte Banking and Insurance Company. After the bank became insolvent, Daniel was unwilling to assume the responsibility of administering the said trust without protection from the Charlotte County Circuit Court.

Charlotte Banking and Insurance Company Business Records were used as evidence in the chancery case, S. C. Daniel, trustee versus Charlotte Banking and Insurance Company, heard in the Circuit Court of Charlotte County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Charlotte Banking and Insurance Company Business Records, 1872-1909, record the instituitons financial activites. They consist of blotter and ticklers, checkbooks, drafts, journals, ledgers, bills receivable books, cashiers' books, and day books.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For additional information see the Charlotte County Chancery Cause, S. C. Daniel, trustee versus Charlotte Banking and Insurance Company. It can be found in the Chancery Records Index at the Library of Virginia web site. The index number is 1908-028.
